title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Hostage-Taking and the Wrongful Detention of United States Nationals Abroad
summary: The document is a presidential notice from July 15, 2025, published in the Federal Register, announcing the continuation of a national emergency regarding hostage-taking and the wrongful detention of U.S. nationals abroad. The emergency was initially declared on July 19, 2022, under Executive Order 14078, citing these acts as threats to national security, foreign policy, and the economy. The notice emphasizes that such acts, perpetrated by terrorist organizations, criminal groups, and foreign states, continue to pose significant threats. Therefore, the national emergency is extended for another year beyond July 19, 2025, in accordance with the National Emergencies Act. The notice will be published in the Federal Register and transmitted to Congress.
